item.title: Chat GPT, The FUTURE Of AI And Is It The End Of Human Civilization? | Tom Bilyeu - Tom Bilyeu
item.description:
Click here to download your FREE guide to 100x YOUR EFFICIENCY IN 10 EASY STEPS: https://bit.ly/3F8qOJL
Chat GPT AI went from 0 to over 100Million users in less than 2 months. AI is super fucking dangerous, but it‚Äôs inevitable, will make our lives better, and you should CAREFULLY love it.
Is AI dangerous? Next to thermonuclear war and an asteroid strike, I‚Äôd say it‚Äôs the most radically dangerous threat that we face as a species. Buuuuut I‚Äôm still super excited. And by the end of this video you will be too.
If you‚Äôre terrified of AI right now, you‚Äôre rational. If you‚Äôre not at least worried it will take a wrong turn into James Cameron territory, you‚Äôre not paying attention. To paraphrase Elon Musk, the human endeavor to create AI could be the first step towards a technological utopia or a demon summoning circle. It‚Äôs not clear which way it will go. But one thing is for sure, we will not control it. And he‚Äôs right, but the truth is, the genie is out of the bottle, and we‚Äôre going to have to deal with it.
For the most part our insatiable drive for progress is awesome. The modern world really is a miracle. We have buses that fly for the love of god. And if people like Eric Weinstein are correct, our thirst for progress will lead us to building technology that doesn‚Äôt just allow us to fly around the world, it will give us the ability to manipulate time and space itself - propelling us well beyond our solar system at faster than light speeds.
I fear it will be a bit of both.
AI, which simply stands for Artificial Intelligence, is getting smart. Really smart. And AI doesn‚Äôt have to outsmart us by much to completely dominate us. Let me give you an example for scale: A moron is technically someone with an IQ of about 70. The average IQ in the US is 98. Einstein was estimated to be 160. And according to the Guiness book of World Records, the highest IQ ever recorded came in at a whopping 210. That means that a super genius is only 3 times smarter than a moron. But Einstein, who was actually only 2.3 times smarter than a moron, had insights that gave birth to nuclear power and nuclear bombs, not to mention lasers, GPS, and a whole lot more. Said another way, a little intelligence goes a loooooooong way.
Nuclear warheads are scary enough, but AI isn‚Äôt going to be a little smarter than Einstein, it‚Äôs going to be a LOT smarter. Not 5 times smarter or 10 times or even 10,000 times smarter. We‚Äôre talking millions of times smarter.
Despite the reality of all the bad stuff that‚Äôs coming, here are three traps we must avoid. 1. Burying our heads in the sand. 2. Panicking. 3. Trying to abolish AI.
Panicking is the same as actively taking your own intelligence offline. When you panic, blood leaves your prefrontal cortex, which is the seat of high level cognition. Therefore it actually makes you dumber. And in the face of artificial super intelligence that strikes me as a very bad idea.
This is going to be the bleakest thing that I say today, but if we‚Äôre going to walk a wise path forward, we‚Äôve got to face all of this. And, as they say, it‚Äôs darkest right before dawn, which I promise is coming. But first, here‚Äôs the reality you will instantly know to be true - when humans find powerful things we use them.
Because AI as a weapon is a zero sum game. If only one nation develops it, it will be winner take all. And no one can risk an adversary getting Artificial Super Intelligence while they sit around entering funny prompts into ChatGPT.
In the short term you need to do three things:
1. Reframe your thinking around AI. Don‚Äôt see it as the enemy. See it as a tool. You‚Äôre not going to be replaced by AI, at least not yet. You‚Äôre going to be replaced by a human using AI. Be the human that replaces others. 2. Figure out how AI is going to disrupt you. Face it head on. Don‚Äôt run. Don‚Äôt hide. Identify your vulnerabilities and shore up your skill set. 3. Identify all of the AI tools that are relevant to you and master them. Learn absolutely everything you can.
Remember, this is the very beginning of a very aggressive revolution. Moving quickly gives you advantages.
First of all, let me acknowledge that I‚Äôm a pundit here, not an expert. While we‚Äôre working feverishly to integrate AI into our company‚Äôs workflow, I‚Äôm not the guy who can tell you how AI works under the hood. So what follows will be me thinking out loud based on what I‚Äôve learned from the experts in my attempts to use AI in both my daily life and the daily operations of my company.
item.itunes:subtitle: by Tom Bilyeu published on Wednesday, March 15 2023 at 23:13:01

item.title: TIEMPOS DECISIVOS: EL FINAL DEL PRINCIPIO - Vlog de Marc Vidal - Marc Vidal

Y ahora, han decidido emitir CDBCs para que no puedas quejarte. Como te digo, os dejo con dos v√≠deos de esta semana. Uno en Horizonte y otro en El Cascabel. De los pocos sitios que me permiten ir. item.title: The Best Way To Launch Your Startup | Startup School - Y Combinator
item.description:
Kat Ma√±alac is the head of YC's Outreach team and advises early stage founders on their launches during the YC batch. She shares the multitude of ways to launch a product and how to get attention for them. Her talk provides tangible strategies and examples of startup launches and will change the way you think about launching.
Apply to Y Combinator: https://www.ycombinator.com/apply/ Work at a startup: https://www.ycombinator.com/jobs
Chapters (Powered by https://bit.ly/chapterme-yc) - 00:00 - Launching Your Startup 01:28 - When Should I Launch My Startup? 03:42 - One Sentence Pitch 05:19 - How to Create a Short Memorable Description 09:17 - When is the X for Y Construction Not Too Cliche? 12:05 - Types of Launches 20:43 - Summary

item.title: How to Build An MVP | Startup School - Y Combinator
item.description:
Y Combinator Group Partner, Michael Seibel, explains how to build a minimum viable product (MVP) for your startup idea. Using examples from real YC companies, Michael walks through how to determine your MVP feature set, build prototypes and demos for user testing, and present your MVP to early customers or investors.
Apply to Y Combinator: https://www.ycombinator.com/apply/ Work at a startup: https://www.ycombinator.com/jobs
Chapters (Powered by https://bit.ly/chapterme-yc) - 00:00 - How to Build an Minimum Viable Product (MVP)? 01:50 - Pre-launch Startup Goals 04:26 - Founders Biggest Fear 07:17 - Examples - Software MVP 07:48 - Airbnb 08:36 - Twitch 09:15 - Stripe 10:36 - Solving Hair On Fire Problem 14:12 - Build an MVP Quickly 15:51 - Outro

item.title: Biden: "Doctors allow you to live; nurses make you want to live" - CBS News
item.description: During a speech about mental health awareness, Vice President Joe Biden joked, "doctors allow you to live; nurses make you want to live" - before quickly clarifying: "male nurses and female nurses."

item.title: Neuroscientist: This Simple Skill Will Make You More Powerful In Life | Andrew Huberman - Diy Things
item.description:
Neuroscientist: This Simple Skill Will Make You More Powerful In Life | Andrew Huberman
Also, in this video Neuroscientist - Andrew Huberman explains the 5 things in life which cannot be replaced.
Neuroscientist: There's NO replacement for these 5 Things | Andrew Huberman. 2023
Neuroscientist Dr. Andrew Huberman shares his insights on the five habits that have no replacement when it comes to maintaining good health and well-being. He emphasizes the importance of getting enough sleep, regular exercise, a balanced and nutritious diet, socializing with others, and staying hydrated.
#andrewhuberman #huberman #speech #advice #motivation

item.title: Troy Aikman Talks Tom Brady's Retirement, Super Bowl Memories & Cowboys 2023 Plan - Green Light with Chris Long
item.description:
Troy Aikman joins Chris Long to discuss Tom Brady's retirement and how he'll transition into broadcasting with FOX. Getting a call from Andy Reid to come out of retirement, favorite Super Bowl memories, and throwing the ball against Deion Sanders.
(00:00) - Troy talks Tom Brady's retirement and his transition to the booth, calling games with Joe Buck and the New England vs Atlanta Super Bowl. (13:55) - Troy's Story of being called by Andy Reid to come out of retirement to play for the Eagles (16:15) - Troy's Super Bowl memories, victory parties and SBLVII predictions. (29:00) - Cowboy's areas of improvements and throwing the ball to Deion Sanders in the Super Bowl.

item.title: Best Coding Habits to Adopt in 2023 - Juan Carlos Fontecha
item.description:
Welcome to the new year! As software engineers, it's important to continually improve and refine our skills to ensure we are writing high-quality, maintainable code. In this video, we'll discuss some good coding habits that you can adopt in the new year to help you become a more efficient and effective programmer. Whether you're a seasoned developer or just starting out, I'm hoping these habits will help you write better code and advance your career!
A couple of you were asking about the keyboard & journal in the thumbnail, so here they are! ‚å®Ô∏è Logitech MX Mechanical Mini: https://jfon.tech/thumbnail-keyboard üìï Moleskin Classic (Plain): https://jfon.tech/dev-journal
If you're interested in the equipment I use to record, I made a kit for it! https://jfon.tech/yt-kit

item.title: 4 ONE-MINUTE Habits That Save Me 20+ Hours a Week - Time Management For Busy People - Liam Porritt
item.description:
The first 100 people to download Endel will get a free week of audio experiences - https://app.adjust.com/b8wxub6?campaign=liamporritt_January2023&adgroup=youtube
In our busy lives, a few hours a week means time for a date, or a few hours of self-love pruning in the bath - so imagine what you could do with 10, 20 or even more extra time each week ü§Ø
Well, from reading some of the best time management books out there, these are my top 4 quick habits to efficiently manage your time, which save me hours each week üôå They are simple, but hugely effective techniques to make the most of our 16 or so waking hours a day, and honestly are some of the core techniques that allow me to keep up a demanding career as a corporate lawyer, while running multiple businesses on the side üë®‚Äçüíª
The key to these habits is (as with all habits) consistency‚Ä¶ kinda obvious, I know. But with these habits especially, they really don‚Äôt take much effort, but they do require a consistent consciousness of how you are working. So, try to keep each of these in mind as you get ready for, and then during, each of your work sessions ü´∂
00:00 How I Juggle Everything 00:28 Cinema Mode 02:12 Batch By Project & Task 06:27 Avoid Work 07:42 Multitask
‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶.
Menos - Minimalist, sustainable design (by Liam & Beth)
Sign up to get pre-launch access to one of only 200 grey and 400 black Menos backpack, made from recycled plastic - https://wearemenos.com ‚ú®
Beth and I have created Menos to bring minimalist, sustainable design to help us all boss the everyday. Follow Menos (@wearemenos on Instagram) - https://instagram.com/wearemenos
‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶.

‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶.
My Free Trello Masterclass
'More Focus, Less Stress - Build Your Ultimate Productivity System in Trello' is my FREE course (Trello is also FREE), which you can take by signing up for a free 2-week SkillShare trial: https://skl.sh/3h2XpV1
... The course walks you through how to build your customised version of my insanely powerful (but simple) Trello productivity system (aka the app that keeps me focused for 10 hours per day!) üì±
‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶.
About Me
I'm a lawyer, part-time YouTuber, son, brother, startup founder, fianc√©, black coffee drinker and plant dad. I graduated from Cambridge University (where I studied French and Spanish), topped my law school class and now work for a corporate law firm in London as a trainee solicitor (which takes up a lot of my time)!
Around that, I'm a big fan of discovering new ways of thinking, of balancing work with life, and of performing to the very best of my ability. Ohh, and being happy. And I try to share all that on this YouTube channel üòÄ
Fun fact: I believe we massively overplay the role of ‚Äúnatural talent‚Äù üòÆ AND‚Ä¶ I also believe that TOGETHER, WE ARE ALL CAPABLE OF POSITIVITY, PRODUCTIVITY AND SUCCESS.
üì∏ Instagram ‚Äì https://www.instagram.com/liam.porritt/ üåç My little kingdom ‚Äì https://liamporritt.com
